text:
Difference in amount taxed at 37%: $300,000
Tax Savings: $300,000 × (37% - 35%) = $6,000 direct savings
Plus tax deferral benefit on full $300,000 payment
On 12/10/2024 at 10:21 AM, Robert Moyer wrote:
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 10:38 AM)
Subject:Re: Safeco/Fidelity
Attachments:Safeco.jpg (64 KB)
Notes below. Thanks for the heads up.
Safeco-
For the 12th, I deposited $756.50 today
For the 02nd, I deposited $756.50 today
BofA-
I think the number left for me after those is anything above $250. If that is incorrect, please let me know. I realize I still have some things that
pull from that, so I did not want to yank mine yet.
$300k-
I planned on hitting my deadline, but if I can do something to help you, I'll come in on a different day. I am more than happy to see how I can
help you.
On 12/10/2024 at 09:52 AM, Christine Moyer wrote:
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 12/10/2024 at 09:52 AM)
Subject:Safeco/Fidelity
Safeco payment of 756.50 is due on the 12th and will pull from the jt Bank of America account. I just deposited my portion of 225. Can you
do your portion of 532?
The next payment will be due on Jan 2.
I want to make sure there is sufficient funds for check for Max’s passport clears.
Fidelity. I saw the split of msft account. I looked and there was indeed a deposit of additional msft shares on Dec 2. Let me come back on the
cash balance and if we use to settle HELOC as you suggest.
Your cash transfer to me of approx 300k is due by end of year. Do you have a sense if I will receive that earlier? I’m trying to navigate if I sell
stock now to pay bills or just wait for the cash.
